title: quarkus-platform-descriptor-json-plugin was removed, but is still mentioned in the documentation

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Describe the bug

With the change https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/26299 the `io.quarkus:quarkus-platform-descriptor-json-plugin` was removed.

The platform guide (https://quarkus.io/guides/platform) still mentions the plugin in the sections [https://quarkus.io/guides/platform#platform-descriptor](Quarkus Platform Descriptor) and [https://quarkus.io/guides/platform#platform-properties](Quarkus Platform Properties).

### Expected behavior

The guide should mention the plugin `io.quarkus:quarkus-platform-bom-maven-plugin`

### Actual behavior

The plugin `io.quarkus:quarkus-platform-descriptor-json-plugin` is shown in the code snippets.

### How to Reproduce?

- Page: https://quarkus.io/guides/platform
- Source: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/docs/src/main/asciidoc/platform.adoc

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.11.0.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
